text: Tower Hamlets Local Plan 21 INTRODUCTIONSETTING THE SCENE Deprivation and inequality 8.12 Tower Hamlets remains a borough of extremes and contrasts. Deprivation and poverty across the population is widespread. While there are pockets of affluence in locations proximate to the City Fringe, River Thames and Canary Wharf, there remains a significant disparity across a range of indicators related to education, overcrowding, income, and employment. BACK TO CONTENTS 8.13 The council conducted a poverty review between March to June 2021. This review found that in 2019/20, 28 per cent of children in Tower Hamlets were living in a low-income family. Once housing costs are considered, 56% of children in Tower Hamlets were living in a low-income family - the highest level of child poverty in the England. 44% of older people in Tower Hamlets live in low-income households the highest proportion in England.
